knowledge_graph.title: Cardamom
knowledge_graph.description: Cardamom, sometimes cardamon or cardamum, is a spice made from the seeds of several plants in the genera Elettaria and Amomum in the family Zingiberaceae. Both genera are native to the Indian subcontinent and Indonesia.

related_questions.question: What is cardamom supposed to taste like?
related_questions.snippet: Cardamom has a unique and distinctive flavor. It's challenging to describe but has peppery, piney, eucalyptus, and menthol-like notes, but the taste of cardamom is also floral with hints of citrus. This blend of sweet, peppery, pungent, and aromatic flavors actually makes it an incredibly versatile spice.
related_questions.title: Behind the Seasoning: Cardamom - What is it? Uses & Recipes

related_questions.question: What does cardamom do to your body?
related_questions.snippet: Cardamom is an herb that is often used as a spice in foods. The seeds and the oil from the seeds are sometimes used to make medicine. Cardamom contains chemicals that might kill some bacteria, reduce swelling, and help the immune system.
related_questions.title: CARDAMOM - Uses, Side Effects, and More - WebMD

related_questions.question: What is cardamom usually used for?
related_questions.snippet: It has a distinctive flavor that complements both sweet and savory dishes. People may use cardamom seeds and pods in curries, desserts, and meat dishes, as well as in beverages, such as coffee and chai tea. People may purchase cardamom as: whole seed pods with the seeds inside.
related_questions.title: Cardamom: 7 health benefits, dosage, and side effects

related_questions.question: What can I use instead of cardamom?
related_questions.snippet: Both cinnamon and nutmeg are each widely recommended as cardamom substitutes. Cinnamon is the most popular of the two for use as a standalone cardamom replacement; however, nutmeg is still a popular and relatively inexpensive alternative.
related_questions.title: Best Cardamom Substitute? - RawSpiceBar

buttons.subtitle: Is Cardamom Good In Coffee?
buttons.title: Cardamom Coffee - Recipes - Whole Foods Market
buttons.snippet: Strong coffee flavored with cardamom is popular in Israel and other parts of the Middle East. One method for making it is to simply drop whole cardamom pods into small cups of thick, rich coffee, and the other is to actually brew the coffee and cardamom together as in this versatile recipe.
snippet_highlighted_words: Strong coffee flavored with cardamom is popular in Israel and other parts of the Middle East

buttons.subtitle: Is Cardamom Sweet Or Savory?
buttons.title: Behind the Seasoning: Cardamom - What is it? Uses & Recipes
buttons.snippet: The distinctive cardamom taste has both sweet and savory notes, meaning that it's good for salads, breads, main dishes, desserts, and drinks.

buttons.subtitle: What Does Clove And Cardamom Taste Like
buttons.title: Cardamom vs. Clove - iSpice You
buttons.snippet: Cardamom's taste is both refreshing and exotic, making it a cherished spice in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Scandinavian cuisines. Clove: Clove provides a strong and pungent flavor characterized by its warm and sweet spiciness. It has a distinct earthiness with a slightly bitter undertone.
snippet_highlighted_words: Clove provides a strong and pungent flavor characterized by its warm and sweet spiciness
